ruling_headline: That's no typo, 100 years
statement: "You know, Sen. McCain said the other day that we might have troops (in Iraq) for 100 years..."

ruling_link_text: Clinton promoted children's health care
ruling_headline: Clinton promoted children's health care
statement: "There are 7,000 kids in New Hampshire who have health care because I helped to create the Children's Health Insurance Program."

ruling_link_text: He fought to improve it, then voted for it
ruling_headline: He fought to improve it, then voted for it
statement: "You said you would vote against the Patriot Act, then you came to the Senate, you voted for it."

ruling_link_text: Lobbyists live in Obama's glass house
ruling_headline: Lobbyists live in Obama's glass house
statement: "Sen. Obama's chair in New Hampshire is a lobbyist. He lobbies for the drug companies."

ruling_link_text: Her comparison is too selective
ruling_headline: Her comparison is too selective
statement: "Average families are spending roughly $2,000 more a year on energy costs. ... It's like a $2,000 energy tax in just the last seven years, more than three times what the typical American family received from the Bush tax cuts."

ruling_link_text: If she's right, Bill's a criminal
statement_context: a comment to a shopper at a supermarket in Des Moines, Iowa.
ruling_headline: If she's right, Bill's a criminal
statement: "I can't sign money. That's illegal."

ruling_link_text: Need, not wealth, prompted estate taxes
statement_context: a town hall meeting in Derry, N.H.
ruling_headline: Need, not wealth, prompted estate taxes
statement: "The estate tax, which came into being by Republicans like Teddy Roosevelt and others ... is there for a real simple reason: In America, we've never liked the idea of massive inherited wealth."

ruling_link_text: Indeed, Bush did it his way
ruling_headline: Indeed, Bush did it his way
statement: "George Bush ... used a signing statement (on a FEMA bill) to say, 'I don't have to follow that, unless I choose to.' "

ruling_link_text: The ugly truths
ruling_headline: The ugly truths
statement: "Productivity has risen 18 percent ...yet wages have stayed flat... There are 5-million more people in poverty here in our country than there were in 2000."

ruling_link_text: Can't blame Bush
ruling_headline: Can't blame Bush
statement: "Thanks to President Bush's policies....The income gap is now higher than at any time since the Great Depression."

ruling_link_text: A legitimate beef with ham sandwich regulations
ruling_headline: A legitimate beef with ham sandwich regulations
statement: "A ham and cheese sandwich on one slice of bread is the responsibility of the USDA ... But a ham and cheese sandwich on two slices of bread is the responsibility of the Food and Drug Administration."

ruling_link_text: Ridiculous evidence -- but true
ruling_headline: Ridiculous evidence -- but true
statement: "Senator Obama's relatives and friends say he has been talking about running for president for at least the last 15 years," a campaign spokesman said.

ruling_link_text: 15-million is okay guess, but not a fact
ruling_headline: 15-million is okay guess, but not a fact
statement: Barack Obama's health care plan "would leave 15-million Americans out."

ruling_link_text: Obama's plan would leave out some, but nobody knows how many
ruling_headline: Obama's plan would leave out some, but nobody knows how many
statement: Barack Obama's health care plan "would leave 15 million Americans out."

ruling_link_text: A lot of time, but the math is off
ruling_headline: A lot of time, but the math is off
statement: "Americans spend 100-million hours a year filling out these forms (FAFSA). That is the equivalent of 55,500 full-time jobs."

ruling_link_text: Edwards was worried about cost
ruling_headline: Edwards was worried about cost
statement: "When Sen. Edwards ran in 2004, he wasn't for universal health care. I'm glad he is now."

ruling_link_text: Why withhold when you can delay?
ruling_headline: Why withhold when you can delay?
statement: "My husband has not withheld a single document."

ruling_link_text: Not all records are available
ruling_headline: Not all records are available
statement: "All of the records, as far as I know, about what we did with health care, those are already available."

ruling_link_text: NIH funding is up under Bush
ruling_headline: NIH funding is up under Bush
statement: "It's just outrageous that under President Bush, the National Institutes of Health have been basically decreased in funding."

ruling_link_text: Tax for the rich only, but not anymore
ruling_headline: Tax for the rich only, but not anymore
statement: "The Alternative Minimum Tax was never intended to hit people in middle income, upper middle income. It was meant for people who are rich and evading taxes."

ruling_link_text: Cherry-picking Obama's quotes
ruling_headline: Cherry-picking Obama's quotes
statement: Sen. Obama "made the very argument he is now criticizing back in November 2006."

ruling_link_text: He's stretching the story
ruling_headline: He's stretching the story
statement: Nearly half of Hispanic voters in Arizona's last election supported four measures that were "very tough on illegal immigration."

ruling_link_text: There were 22 other co-sponsors
statement_context: a TV ad airing in Iowa and New Hampshire.
ruling_headline: There were 22 other co-sponsors
statement: "She stood by our National Guard and Reserve and kept standing till they received health care they deserved."

ruling_link_text: She's been active on issues for 9/11 workers
ruling_headline: She's been active on issues for 9/11 workers
statement: "She stood by ground zero workers who sacrificed their health after so many sacrificed their lives and kept standing till this administration took action."

ruling_link_text: Standing up, but not alone
statement_context: a TV ad airing in Iowa and New Hampshire.
ruling_headline: Standing up, but not alone
statement: "Hillary stood up for universal health care when almost no one else would, and kept standing till 6-million kids had coverage."

ruling_link_text: No records, but there are witnesses
statement_context: a forum hosted by Slate/Yahoo/Huffington Post.
ruling_headline: No records, but there are witnesses
statement: "Look, I believe in accountability. In 1983, I led the effort in Arkansas to improve our schools."

ruling_link_text: Indeed, uninsured people have higher mortality rate
statement_context: a speech in Des Moines, Iowa.
ruling_headline: Indeed, uninsured people have higher mortality rate
statement: "Each year, 18,000 people die in America because they don't have health care."

ruling_link_text: A broad definition of "medical bills"
statement_context: a speech in Des Moines, Iowa.
ruling_headline: A broad definition of "medical bills"
statement: Half of all personal bankruptcies in America "are caused by medical bills."

ruling_link_text: Optimistic math
statement_context: a speech in Des Moines, Iowa.
ruling_headline: Optimistic math
statement: Her health care plan will cost $110-billion in the first year, which can be paid for with savings.

ruling_link_text: Studies confirm premiums are up 98 percent
statement_context: a speech in Des Moines, Iowa.
ruling_headline: Studies confirm premiums are up 98 percent
statement: Health insurance premiums "have almost doubled ... since 2000."

ruling_link_text: Little impact from making English 'official'
ruling_headline: Little impact from making English 'official'
statement: English "is our national language...if it becomes official, that means in a place like New York City you can't print ballots in any other language."

ruling_link_text: But N.Y. numbers may not be meaningful elsewhere
statement_context: a comment by husband Bill Clinton on Larry King Live.
ruling_headline: But N.Y. numbers may not be meaningful elsewhere
statement: "In New York, when she ran for reelection, she carried 58 of our 62 counties. George Bush had won 40 counties in New York just two years earlier."

ruling_link_text: Indeed, Hispanics have highest percentage
ruling_headline: Indeed, Hispanics have highest percentage
statement: \u201CThirty-four percent of Hispanics don\u2019t have any health care at all, don\u2019t have any health insurance.\u201D

ruling_link_text: Hillary is famous in Europe
statement_context: a speech by husband Bill Clinton at a Concord, N.H. rally.
ruling_headline: Hillary is famous in Europe
statement: "In every single country, she had a majority of the vote -- or more of those who'd already made up their minds."

ruling_link_text: Black and Hispanic homeowners have more subprimes
ruling_headline: Black and Hispanic homeowners have more subprimes
statement: "About 40 percent of Hispanic homeowners have subprime mortgages."

ruling_link_text: There are plenty of jobs available for trained automobile and airline technicians, but Clinton overestimates how much they pay.
ruling_headline: There are plenty of jobs available for trained automobile and airline technicians, but Clinton overestimates how much they pay.
statement: "Let's pay attention to kids who are not going to college, which ends up being about 60 percent of the kids... and get them trained for the jobs that are there. Because, you know, there are auto mechanic jobs paying $50,000, $60,000 that they can't get filled. There are airline mechanic jobs paying a lot of money that can't get filled." Remarks at AFSCME forum 6/19/2007

ruling_link_text: An accurate summary of economic stats
ruling_headline: An accurate summary of economic stats
statement: "Corporate profits are up, CEO pay is up, but average wages of Americans are flat."
